how to add reflections to your application

a. how to add reflections maven plugin so that your modules are reflections ready at runtime, without the need to scan the codebase at bootstrap

on your relevant pom, add the following:

	    <plugin>
                <groupId>org.reflections</groupId>
                <artifactId>reflections-maven</artifactId>
                <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>reflections</goal>
                        </goals>
                        <phase>process-classes</phase>
                        
                        <configuration>
                            <destinations>
                                ${project.build.outputDirectory}/reflections/${artifactId}-reflections.xml
                            </destinations>
                            <elementTypesToScan>annotations</elementTypesToScan>
                            <computeTransitiveClosure>true</computeTransitiveClosure>
                            <invertedElementTypes>annotations</invertedElementTypes>
                            <!--<ignoredFqnPrefixes></ignoredFqnPrefixes>-->
                        </configuration>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>


b. how to use reflection at runtime using post compiled resources

get an instance or Reflections object, something like:

        Reflections reflections = Reflections.getInstance()
                .setConfiguration(Configuration
                        .build()
                        .setFetchPostCompiledResources(true)
                        .addUrls(ClasspathHelper.getUrlsForCurrentClasspath())
                        .setScanSources(false)
                        .setComputeTransitiveClosure(false));
